section.title: Modals of deduction (past)
section.sectiontitle: Use must have (been) for things which were certain, and might have (been) for a possibility.
section.text2a: There might have been lots of reasons for them leaving.

section.title: Modals of deduction (past)
section.sectiontitle: Use could have been/may have been for possibility.
section.text1a: We could have been left there for ages.
section.text2a: There may have been a good reason for the delay, but we were angry nevertheless.
section.sectiontitle2: Use will have been when we are fairly certain.
section.text3a: That will have been Jim. He always calls at this time.
